basics.name: Vivian Nguyen
basics.label: Data Scientist
basics.summary: Vivian hails from the Jersey Shore, and now resides in Boston. She is set to graduate from Harvard University as a double major in Statistics and Government in May 2024. Over the last four years, she discovered her passion for data science and has applied it in her coursework and extracurricular pursuits at consulting firms and Harvard's library. Her main interests lie in predictive modeling, generative AI, and recommendation algorithms. Her favorite realms of exploration are digital media, politics, sports (go Celtics!), chess, and music.

work.name: Harvard Data Analytics Group
highlights: Constructed logistic classification and NLP analysis models in R and Python to identify and analyze reputable users, influencers, and misinformation spreaders on #MedTwitter. Final classification models achieved 86% accuracy
Established ETL pipeline that continually ingests user data, extracts features, and applies classification with Twitterâ€™s API

Built secure, automatic, and filterable dashboard for  ($1B in revenue) nonprofit to display donor advanced sentiment analytics, pain points, most frequently-used keywords, and key themes identified from NLP analysis of call transcripts
Wrote advanced SQL queries to optimize data retrieval, improving real-time dashboard update speeds by 20%

work.name: Trilogy Interactive (Digital Marketing Firm)
highlights: Engineered EOD autopilot long-term reporting pipeline for campaign donations, decreasing production time by 20%
Implemented an automated hourly campaign performance tracking system, raising first-hour revenue prediction accuracy by 70% and overall projection accuracy by 60% across 40 client projects
Built reformatting script for daily data refreshes in JavaScript and integrated it into master production pipeline
Developed a robust NLP analysis framework for analyzing source codes, messages, and fundraising performance database

work.name: Harvard Geospatial Library
highlights: Wrangled and standardized JSON metadata, including feature engineering with Google API to obtain granular spatial data for complete recordkeeping. Updated documentation to be readable by both data librarians and library audience
Co-authored data guide with analysis and visualizations of 11,000+ datasets for Harvard Map Collection

work.name: APIAVote
highlights: Scraped and aggregated voting and school sites to build election directory and collegiate outreach databases
Utilized Excel and R to analyze disaggregated 2022 Asian American Voter Survey data; presented results in press briefing

awards.title: Charles Bonaparte Prize
awards.summary: An award to be made 'at the end of the junior year to that member of the class concentrating in government who, without regard to financial need, has the highest academic distinction in that subject.'

projects.name: AI Screenwriting: Multi-Agent ChatGPT Model
highlights: Designed and implemented a multi-agent model to generate, critique, and refine movie pitches using OpenAI and IMDb APIs and NLP.
Pitches are assessed via cinematic and marketability criteria and optimized iteratively.
1 pitch is now in development.

projects.name: 2022 Midterm House Forecast
highlights: Forecasted 435 House races with multivariate regression models in R.
Incumbent two-party vote share predicted within 0.4 p.p., incumbent seat  count within 4 seats, and 83% of all district races and 92% of non-toss-up races correctly called.

projects.name: Predicting Undergraduate Dining Hall Occupancy
highlights: Data cleaning, EDA, feature engineering, and model (time series, F, boosting) tuning, testing, and selection in Python.
Utilized LASSO regularization for feature selection.
Final dining swipes per dining hall per meal were predicted with 81% accuracy.
